items.title: AI Systems Architecture in Seattle: My Approach to Multi-Agent Workflows
items.content_text: How I approach AI systems architecture in Magnolia, Seattle: semantic memory, multi-agent orchestration, and protocol-driven design grounded in open-source work and everyday life.

items.title: Building Semantic Memory Systems: Lessons from 180+ Open-Source Experiments
items.content_text: What I’ve learned from building semantic memory systems across 180+ open-source repositories: structure, reversibility, and agent-friendly formats.

items.title: The Seattle AI Landscape and Where My Work Fits In
items.content_text: A view of the Seattle AI ecosystem from Magnolia, and how semantic memory, multi-agent orchestration, and protocol-first design fit into that landscape.
